member.name: M:JHSoftware.SimpleDNS.Plugin.ICloneAnswerPlugIn.Lookup(JHSoftware.SimpleDNS.Plugin.IDNSRequest,JHSoftware.SimpleDNS.Plugin.DomainName@,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Perform an clone name lookup
member.param: DNS request information.
Return name of zone to clone answer from, or Null/Nothing if no alias is found.
Return the number of labels (segment between dots) of request.QName (from left) that make up the "prefix". Return 0 for no prefix (QName = Zone name).
Return true if the AA flag (authoritative) should be set in cloned answer. Return false to use the AA falg value from the answer that is being cloned.
member.remarks: Simple DNS Plus creates a cloned answer based on the prefixLabels, cloneFromZone and forceAA parameters. First a "clone QName" is constructed from the prefix + cloneFromZone. Then a new DNS request for "clone QName" and same query type (A, MX, etc.) as original request is processed. The resulting DNS answer is cloned by changing record names as well as domain names in record data. Names that end with cloneFromZone will have this ending changed to the originally requested zone name (request.QName less prefix). IMPORTANT: Plug-ins will be re-queried using "clone QName", so it is important to design this function so that this does not cause an endless loop.

member.name: M:JHSoftware.SimpleDNS.Plugin.IViewUI.MsgFromViewUI(System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: A message has been received from a View UI instance
member.param: The connection ID of the View UI sending the message. This ID can be used for sending a message back to the same ViewUI throught the MsgToViewUI event.
The message data received (format/content defined by plug-in)
member.remarks: This method is called by the ViewUI.SendMsgToService (via Simple DNS Plus infrastructure). Several View UIs may be connected at the same time, for example if the server computer has multiple terminal server sessions open.

member.name: E:JHSoftware.SimpleDNS.Plugin.IViewUI.MsgToViewUI
member.summary: Raise this event to send a message to the View UI.
member.param: Connection ID of the View UI to send the message to. Use -1 to send the message to all connected View UIs.
The message data to send (format/content defined by plug-in)
member.remarks: Raising this event calls the ViewUI.MsgFromService method (via Simple DNS Plus infrastructure). Several View UIs may be connected at the same time, for example if the server computer has multiple terminal server sessions open.

member.name: M:JHSoftware.SimpleDNS.Plugin.OptionsUI.LoadData(System.String)
member.summary: Load plug-in configuration data into OptionsUI
member.param: Configuration data (user defined format). Null/Nothing for new plug-in instances.
member.remarks: The configuration data corresponds to the string returned by the SaveData method. Simple DNS Plus calls this method when the Plug-In Instance dialog is opened.

member.name: M:JHSoftware.SimpleDNS.Plugin.OptionsUI.ValidateData
member.summary: Validate the data entered by the user in the OptionsUI
member.returns: True if the data entered is valid, otherwise False.
member.remarks: Simple DNS Plus calls this method when the user clicks the OK button in the Plug-In Instance dialog. If the entered data is invalid (method returning False), you should show a message box explaining the problem.

member.name: M:JHSoftware.SimpleDNS.Plugin.OptionsUI.SaveData
member.summary: Save the configuration data entered by the user in the OptionsUI
member.returns: Configuration data (user defined format)
member.remarks: The data returned by this method is used by the LoadData method and the IPlugInBase.LoadConfig method. Simple DNS Plus calls this method only after calling ValidateData and only if ValidateData returns True.

Signal data
Returned result of signal operation

member.param: Signal code
Signal data
member.returns: Result of signal operation

member.name: T:JHSoftware.SimpleDNS.Plugin.ISignal
member.summary: Plug-in specific signaling between plug-in and Simple DNS Plus
member.remarks: Used for unique plug-in situations which require extra information to be passed between the plug-in and Simple DNS Plus. Also allows for the implementation of new features without changing the plug-in interfaces. Plug-in developers who need to retrieve/update settings etc. which are not provided by other plug-in methods may request a unique signal code for this.

member.name: E:JHSoftware.SimpleDNS.Plugin.IUpdateHost.UpdateHost
member.summary: Raise this event to update a host record (A/AAAA) in a local primary DNS zone.
member.param: The name of the host record to update
The new IP address of the host - or null/nothing to delete any existing host records for the name
DNS record TTL value. Specify -1 to use the zone's default TTL value
Any comments to be stored with the DNS record in the zone file
Indicates if the update succeeded (true) or not (false)
If the update failed, this value will contain a short explanation
member.remarks: The update will fail unless a local primary zone with a parent name of the host name exists

member.name: E:JHSoftware.SimpleDNS.Plugin.IUpdateHost.UpdateHostReverse
member.summary: Raise this event to update a reverse DNS record (PTR) in a local primary reverse DNS zone (IPv4 or IPv6).
member.param: The new IP address that the reverse DNS record represents
The host name that the reverse DNS record must point to - or null/nothing to delete any existing reverse records for the IP address
DNS record TTL value. Specify -1 to use the zone's default TTL value
Any comments to be stored with the DNS record in the zone file
Indicates if the update succeeded (true) or not (false)
If the update failed, this value will contain a short explanation
member.remarks: The update will fail unless a local primary reverse zone for the IP address exists

member.name: T:JHSoftware.SimpleDNS.Plugin.IUpdateHost
member.summary: Implement this interface in plug-ins that need to update DNS host records in local DNS zones.

member.name: M:JHSoftware.SimpleDNS.Plugin.ITSIGUpdateHost.GetTSIGKeySecret(JHSoftware.SimpleDNS.Plugin.DomainName,System.String)
member.summary: Called by Simple DNS Plus to get the key value (secret) for a TSIG key in order to verify a TSIG signature of a received dynamic DNS update packet.
member.param: The TSIG key name (user ID) presented by the client
The signing algorithm used (HMAC-MD5, HMAC-SHA1, HMAC-SHA256, HMAC-SHA384 or HMAC-SHA512)
member.returns: TSIG key value (secret), or null/nothing if keyName does not exist

member.summary: Called by Simple DNS Plus to complete a TSIG signed dynamic DNS update
member.param: The IP address that the update request originates from
The TSIG key name (user ID) presented by the client
The signing algorithm used (HMAC-MD5, HMAC-SHA1, HMAC-SHA256, HMAC-SHA384 or HMAC-SHA512)
The name of the updated host record
The IP address of the updated host record
The TTL (time to live) value of the updated host record
member.returns: False if the request update is not allowed - otherwise true
member.remarks: Simple DNS Plus will call this method after calling GetTSIGKeySecret only if the TSIG signature was verfied.

Unique ID for current plug-in instance
Data file path used by Simple DNS Plus

member.name: M:JHSoftware.SimpleDNS.Plugin.IPlugInBase.StartService
member.summary: Start the plug-in service.
member.remarks: Simple DNS Plus calls the StartService asynchronously (on a separate thread) and will not start sending DNS requests to the plug-in before this method returns.

member.summary: Stop the plug-in service.

member.remarks: The state data corresponds to the string returned by the SaveState method.

Data file path used by Simple DNS Plus

member.name: E:JHSoftware.SimpleDNS.Plugin.IPlugInBase.LogLine
member.summary: Raise this event to record a message to the Simple DNS Plus log.

member.name: E:JHSoftware.SimpleDNS.Plugin.IPlugInBase.SaveConfig
member.summary: Raise this event to save configuration data
member.param: Configuration data (user defined format)
member.remarks: Should only be used when the plug-in configuration is changed by something other than the Options dialog.

member.name: E:JHSoftware.SimpleDNS.Plugin.IPlugInBase.AsyncError
member.summary: Raise this event to log an exception from an asynchronous operation.
member.param: The Exception object
member.remarks: Plug-in operations executing in seperate threads (asynchronous methods) should catch and raise this event for all unhandled exceptions. Otherwise Simple DNS Plus will crash in case of such an exception. Execeptions in methods executing in Simple DNS Plus' own threads are automatically caught and should not raise this event.

member.summary: Base plug-in interface for IGetHostPlugIn, IGetAnswerPlugin, and ISkipPlugIn
